data.title: Trains
data.text:
Genève Aéroport <> Geneva (City Center) & Switzerland

All trains departing from / going to Genève-Aéroport station stop in the City Center of Geneva in Geneva-Cornavin station (7-minutes trip between the two stations, up to seven trains per hour at peak hours). A unireso zone 10 ticket for CHF 3.00 allows you to travel to the city centre by train from the airport.

Trains departing from/going to Genève-Aéroport serve, without a change at Geneva-Cornavin, most of Swiss cities: Bern, Bienne, Fribourg, Lausanne, Lucerne, Montreux, Neuchâtel, Sion, Vevey, Zurich, etc.

Swiss train tickets

Swiss train tickets can be purchased via:

the SBB mobile app,

the SBB website, see:

timetable for trains to the airport

timetable for trains from the airport

machines in the stations (payment in CHF, EUR and by credit card),

the machine located in the “baggage reclaim area” of the airport (accessible only to arriving passengers),

the counters of the SBB Travel Centre in Genève-Aéroport station.

More information about tickets and passes

For foreign guests, the Swiss Travel Pass allows you to move across the entire Swiss rail network during 3, 4, 8 or 15 days.

More information about the Swiss Travel Pass

Transport of baggage by train in Switzerland

Travellers can travel baggage-free in Switzerland and thus have free hands and peace of mind, to enjoy their holiday in total relaxation.

SBB transport the baggage from a selection of train stations in Switzerland or from your home, to Genève Aéroport station or vice versa. Travellers can then pick them up two days later.

More information on SBB baggage services and fees.

Genève Aéroport <> France

All trains departing from / going to Genève-Aéroport station stop in the City Center of Geneva in Geneva-Cornavin station (7-minute trip between the two stations, up to seven trains per hour at peak hours).

Departing from / going to the Geneva-Cornavin station, many direct TER/TGV trains serve most of the cities of the Auvergne Rhône-Alpes region (Aix-les-Bains, Bourg-en-Bresse, Chambéry, Grenoble, Lyon, Valence, etc.), as well as the TGV to Paris and Marseille.

“Léman Express” connections serve more than 45 train stations in Switzerland and in France, including the French cities (Annecy, Annemasse, Bonneville, Cluses, Evian-les-Bains, Saint-Gervais-les-Bains, Le Fayet) departing from/going to the Geneva-Cornavin station.

train tickets to France

The train ticket to France can be purchased via:
